Extracellular matrix.Comment: Note that FMA has this as a body substance
Extracellular matrix.Definition: A system of insoluble protein fibrils and soluble complexes composed of carbohydrate polymers linked to protein molecules, i.e. proteoglycans, in the extracellular space. Insoluble protein fibrils are mainly of two types: collagen and elastin; the soluble polymers consist of long carbohydrate chains, linked to proteins.
